main event: A white, balloon-shaped object was observed in a southerly direction over Alsea, Oregon for 30 minutes on March 10, 1958. Radar contact with the object was reported but not confirmed.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 20-25 feet in height and 45-50 feet in diameter, moving at an estimated speed of 3,000-4,500 mph at an altitude of around 50,000 feet.
The observation was made at around 9:00 PM on February 28, 1958.
Several reliable witnesses reported observing the unusual craft, and a sketch was made for reference.
The investigator was unable to find the radar operator or confirm the reliability of the radar report.
The incident report was considered factual and reliable, and was seen and verified by two witnesses, one of whom was an officer experienced in investigating such incidents.
